title: Oscars 2017: Weta Digital wins early Science and Technical award for software
text:
The software was developed for James Cameron's Avatar franchise, which will be filmed in New Zealand. YOUTUBE/OSCARS 
Weta Digital's Iain Matthews, Luca Fascione, and JP Lewis received a Scientific and Technical Oscar for their "Facets" technology. 
Eighteen scientific and technical achievements were recognised at the ceremony at the Beverly Wilshire in Beverly Hills, with the awards' chairman Ray Feeney saying the recipients' work greatly expanded filmmakers' creative choices for storytelling. 
"This year we are particularly pleased to be able to honour not only a wide range of new technologies, but also the pioneering digital cinema cameras that helped facilitate the widespread conversion to electronic image capture for motion picture production," he said. 
Unlike other Oscar awards, the successes recognised at the Scientific and Technical Awards do not need to have been developed in the previous year. 
But they must prove to have contributed significantly to the process of making motion pictures. Ad Feedback 
Other recipients included Brian Whited for the "Meander" drawing system at Disney, and Glenn Sanders and Howard Stark for the "Zaxcom Digital Wireless Microphone System". 
Weta Digital also received the Best Special Visual Effects BAFTA at the EE British Academy Film Awards at the weekend for its involvement with Disney's The Jungle Book. The Miramar company is also up for the visual effects award for the Oscar's main event on February 26. 
For more information about the Oscar's Scientific and Technical Awards, and to see the full list of recipients, see Oscars.org . - Stuff
